item.title: Gautam Gambhir's Position Unsafe: India Head Coach's Wings To Be Clipped If Downward Spiral Continues - News18
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir's Position Unsafe: India Head Coach's Wings To Be Clipped If Downward Spiral Continues

Last Updated: January 01, 2025, 21:16 IST

India’s latest defeat on their ongoing Australia tour has sparked tension between head coach Gautam Gambhir and some players, with media reports suggesting a lack of clear communication between the team management and the players since Gambhir’s arrival.

India have lost five of their last seven Tests and are now in a must-win situation in the fifth and final Test against Australia in Sydney. If the team’s performance doesn’t improve, Gambhir’s position could be reviewed, according to a senior BCCI official.

  1. Gambhir was not the BCCI's first choice for the head coach position.
  2. The BCCI is unhappy with a member of Gambhir's support staff who is accompanied by a personal assistant at all venues.
  3. India must win the Sydney Test to retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and qualify for the World Test Championship final.

“There is a Test match to be played and then there is Champions Trophy. If the performance doesn’t improve, even Gautam Gambhir’s position wouldn’t be safe.” - A senior BCCI official

Source: PTI

item.title: Australia PM Anthony Albanese Hosts Rohit Sharma & Co Ahead of Sydney Test, Cracks Joke At Bumrah - News18
item.description:
Australian PM Hosts Indian Cricket Team Ahead of Sydney Test

Published on January 01, 2025, 22:51 IST

The Indian and Australian cricket teams attended a New Year’s reception hosted by Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and his fiancée, Jodie Haydon, at Kirribilli House. The event featured light-hearted moments and high praise for players, including Prime Minister Albanese reserving special admiration for India’s fast-bowling ace Jasprit Bumrah.

  • Albanese humorously suggested passing a law for Bumrah to bowl left-handed or off one step.
  • Sam Konstas, Australia’s new talent, met his childhood hero, Virat Kohli, and posed for a picture.
  • India’s head coach, Gautam Gambhir, shared his reflections on the tour, highlighting the challenges of playing in Australia.
  • Australian captain Pat Cummins expressed excitement for the decisive Sydney Test match.

With Australia leading the series 2-1, the upcoming Sydney Test promises an intense clash.

item.title: "Everyone Afraid Of Virat Kohli": Team India Told To Make Big Change In 5th Test At SCG - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Everyone Afraid Of Virat Kohli: Team India Told To Make Big Change In 5th Test At SCG

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 | Source: NDTV

With just one Test left in the series against Australia, Team India may consider altering their lineup. Former cricketer Basit Ali suggests demoting Virat Kohli to No. 5 to improve his performance as he has struggled at the No. 4 spot.

  • India is trailing 1-2 in the series and this is their last chance to secure the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Basit Ali believes Kohli's current position is detrimental to his batting performance.
  • Ali calls for a strategic change and highlights that the team management seems hesitant to make changes due to fear of Kohli's reputation.
“If you are not able to score then drop lower down the order; Rohit is doing that but nobody thinking about Virat because everybody's afraid.” – Basit Ali

As they prepare for the 5th Test on January 3, Team India faces a critical moment to decide a strategic shift in player positions.

item.title: Vinod Kambli discharged from hospital, requests everyone to stay away from alcohol | WATCH - India TV News
item.description:
Vinod Kambli discharged from hospital, requests everyone to stay away from alcohol | WATCH

Date: January 1, 2025

Source: India TV News

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli was discharged from the hospital after being treated for various health issues. He emphasized the importance of abstaining from alcohol during his recovery.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akruti Hospital on December 21 due to health deterioration.
  • He walked out of the hospital wearing India's new ODI jersey and was welcomed by fans and supporters.
  • Kambli scored 1084 runs in Test cricket, averaging 54.20, with four centuries.
  • In ODI cricket, he made 2477 runs at an average of 32.59, including two centuries.
  • His first-class cricket record includes nearly 10,000 runs with an average of 59.67.
Kambli wished everyone a Happy New Year and appealed to fans to stay away from alcohol.

Kambli's appeal highlights his ongoing journey of recovery as he emphasizes the significance of health and wellness.

item.title: Naseem Shah Replaced, Saim Ayub Out? Pakistan's Strongest XI For 2nd Test vs SA - OneCricket
item.description:
Pakistan's Potential Lineup for the 2nd Test Against South Africa

Publication Date: Not specifiedSource: Cricket One

After a narrow defeat in the first Test against South Africa, Pakistan is gearing up for a crucial second Test at Newlands, Cape Town. The article discusses potential changes to the team's lineup, focusing on players like Naseem Shah and Saim Ayub who may be at risk of being replaced.

  • Pakistan lost the first Test by two wickets despite solid bowling performances.
  • Saim Ayub struggled in the first Test, raising questions about his place in the lineup.
  • Naseem Shah may be replaced by Mir Hamza due to his inconsistent performance.
  • Pakistan's likely strongest XI includes Shan Masood, Saim Ayub, Babar Azam, and others.
“Saim showcased exemplary form in ODIs and T20Is, which is why we believe Pakistan will likely persist with him for the deciding clash in Cape Town.”

This upcoming match is critical for Pakistan to equalize the series after a disappointing start, prompting potential lineup changes to optimize their chances of success.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir Not 1st Choice Coach, Only A 'Compromise': BCCI Official Drops Bomb - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir Not 1st Choice Coach, Only A 'Compromise': BCCI Official Drops Bomb

Publication Date: January 25, 2025
Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team is facing challenges regarding its leadership and performance, specifically under coach Gautam Gambhir. As tensions rise, clarity around team selection issues has become a concern.

  • Gambhir's capabilities as a coach have come under scrutiny amid poor performances from senior players.
  • Issues regarding communication and confidence among players have been highlighted following Gambhir's appointment.
  • The BCCI is reportedly discussing the future of Gambhir's coaching role, especially if performances do not improve.
"He was never BCCI's first choice (it was VVS Laxman) and some of the well-known overseas names didn't want to coach all three formats, so he was a compromise."

The BCCI is monitoring the team dynamics closely, especially in light of upcoming tournaments.

item.title: Australia Star Criticises 'Snicko', Gives Big Verdict On Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Controversy - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Australia's Alex Carey Defends Yashasvi Jaiswal's DRS Controversy

December 4, 2024 - NDTV

Australia wicketkeeper-batter Alex Carey has defended the third umpire's decision to dismiss India's Yashasvi Jaiswal in the Melbourne Test, stating that the right call was made despite the snicko not picking up any sound.

  • Yashasvi Jaiswal was dismissed on the final day of the Melbourne Test, sparking a row in the cricket world.
  • Alex Carey, the Australian wicketkeeper-batter, backed the third umpire's decision.
  • The snickometer didn't pick up any sound, but the third umpire overturned the on-field umpire's decision based on visual evidence.
  • Australia won the Test by 184 runs and took a 2-1 lead in the series.
"Yeah, I had no doubt. And I think the evidence was really clear that the third umpire made the correct decision." - Alex Carey

The upcoming fifth Test between Australia and India will be played at the Sydney Cricket Ground from January 3.

item.title: Disciplined Australia seek WTC reward in Sydney - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Australia Seeks WTC Final Spot in Sydney

Published on: [Date], Source: [Source]

Australia needs a draw in the ongoing Sydney Test to reclaim the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. However, to secure a spot in the ICC World Test Championship final, they might need at least a draw in their upcoming tour of Sri Lanka.

  • Australia aims to win the Test match and secure the trophy.
  • Mitchell Starc's fitness is under watch after he showed signs of discomfort in the Melbourne Test.
"We know it's a really quality outfit in India, who have shown they are well and truly capable of bouncing back. So for this group, it's head down, another opportunity to win a Test match, and if are able to secure the trophy it would be fantastic." - Steven Smith, Australia's wicketkeeper

Australia is focused on winning the Test match and securing their spot in the World Test Championship final.

item.title: Team India Star Keen To Be 'Interim Captain' In Tests, Calls Himself 'Mr. Fix-It': Report - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Team India Star Keen To Be 'Interim Captain' In Tests, Calls Himself 'Mr. Fix-It': Report

Publication Date: December 31, 2024
Source: NDTV

The search for Rohit Sharma's successor as Test captain is intensifying, with discussions around several players stepping up for leadership roles in the Indian cricket team.

  • The team is looking for a full-time captain as uncertainty looms over Rohit Sharma's future.
  • Jasprit Bumrah led the team in Rohit's absence and a player in the team has proposed his name for the interim captaincy.
  • Some senior players are skeptical about the leadership capabilities of younger teammates.
  • Bumrah is currently viewed as the top candidate for the long-term captaincy following his successful leadership in Perth.
“I can be the 'Mr. Fix-It' for the team's current mess,” said the unnamed player proposing himself for interim captaincy.

In light of Rohit Sharma's potential retirement after the series against Australia, the Indian team must address leadership roles effectively to ensure a smooth transition.

item.title: Alex Carey accepts snicko being 'funny' in BGT but defends third umpire's call in Yashasvi Jaiswal's dism - The Times of India
item.description:
Alex Carey Backs Third Umpire's Decision in Yashasvi Jaiswal's Controversial Dismissal

Date & Source: January 13, 2025, Times of India

Australian wicketkeeper-batter Alex Carey has defended the third umpire's decision to dismiss Indian batter Yashasvi Jaiswal on Day 5 of the Melbourne Test, despite the lack of a clear spike on the snickometer. Carey acknowledged the snickometer's inconsistency in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series but believed the visual evidence supported the umpire's call.

  1. Carey praised the third umpire for making the correct decision based on all available evidence.
  2. The dismissal of Jaiswal, who scored 84 runs, was a turning point in the match.
  3. The decision has sparked debate, with some arguing for the batter and others supporting the umpire's call.
  4. Australia won the match by 184 runs, securing a 2-1 series lead and ending India's WTC Final hopes.

"Yeah, I had no doubt... The third umpire made the correct decision." - Alex Carey

Conclusion: The controversy surrounding Yashasvi Jaiswal's dismissal continues as the series moves to Sydney.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah surpasses Ashwin’s all-time record to set new high in ICC Test rankings - The Times of India
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Sets New High in ICC Test Rankings

January 1, 2025 - Times of India

New Delhi: The New Year brings good news for Indian pacer Jasprit Bumrah as he achieved the highest rating points ever by an Indian bowler, solidifying his position at the top of the ICC Men's Test Bowling Rankings after an exceptional nine-wicket haul in the fourth Test in Melbourne.

  1. Bumrah surpassed his previous best of 904 rating points, which he shared with Ravichandran Ashwin.
  2. With 907 rating points, Bumrah now shares the 17th position on the all-time list with England's former spinner Derek Underwood.
  3. The ICC has shortlisted Bumrah for both the Sir Garfield Sobers Trophy and the Test Cricketer of the Year award.
English bowlers Sydney Barnes (932) and George Lohmann (931) from over a century ago lead the all-time rankings, followed by Imran Khan (922) and Muttiah Muralitharan (920) in third and fourth positions.

Australian captain Pat Cummins, sharing fifth place with Glenn McGrath at 914 points, has improved his standing in the latest rankings issued on Wednesday after their victory against India in the Boxing Day Test at the MCG.

item.title: Nikhil Chaudhary stars as Hurricanes halt Sixers winning streak - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Sydney Sixers' Winning Streak Halted by Hobart Hurricanes in BBL 2024-25

Date: January 1, 2025 Source: Cricbuzz

Sydney Sixers' winning start to the 2024-25 Big Bash season came to a tame end on New Year's Day as they were demolished by the Hobart Hurricanes at the Bellerive Oval in Hobart. After setting a target of 162 for the Sixers, the hosts bowled them out for 111 to clinch a 50-run victory.

  1. All six bowlers for the Hurricanes chipped in with wickets at regular intervals.
  2. Nikhil Chaudhary starred with the bat (42 off 31 balls) and also picked up a wicket.
  3. The Sixers collapsed from 63/3 to 84/8, losing five wickets for 21 runs.
  4. Earlier, Mitchell Owen scored 33 off 17 balls for the Hurricanes.
Sydney Sixers were bowled out for 111, with Jackson Bird being the top scorer with 22.

The Hurricanes' total of 161/6 proved to be more than enough as they handed the Sixers their first defeat of the season.

item.title: Team India Hits Humiliating 45-Year-Old Low, Finish 2024 Without A Single... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Team India Hits Humiliating 45-Year-Old Low, Finish 2024 Without A Single ODI Victory

Publication Date: January 25, 2025

Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team ended 2024 without a single ODI victory, marking their worst performance in this format since 1979, despite winning the T20 World Cup. A disappointing year overall for the team was marred by a 3-0 Test series loss against New Zealand at home.

  • Team clinched the T20 World Cup title in 2024.
  • Finished the year without a single ODI win, the first since 1979.
  • Played only three ODIs, losing two and tying one against Sri Lanka.
  • Ravi Shastri calls for a two-tier system in Test cricket.
  • The Boxing Day Test between India and Australia saw a record attendance.
“To break crowd records that have stood for nearly a century... is testimony to the fact that when the best teams play, the toughest and best format of the game is still alive and thriving.” - Ravi Shastri

This year showcases significant concerns for Team India, particularly in ODI cricket, urging reflection and change moving forward.

item.title: Virat Kohli to MS Dhoni to Jasprit Bumrah: How India star cricketers celebrated New Year 2025 - India.com
item.description:
Virat Kohli to MS Dhoni to Jasprit Bumrah: How India star cricketers celebrated New Year 2025

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 Source: India.com

This article showcases a collection of pictures capturing how famous Indian cricketers such as Virat Kohli, MS Dhoni, and Jasprit Bumrah welcomed the New Year 2025.

  • Virat Kohli celebrated New Year’s Eve with friends and family.
  • Jasprit Bumrah and his wife Sanjana Ganesan enjoyed a dinner at a restaurant in Sydney after their son went to sleep.
  • MS Dhoni was spotted celebrating in Goa with his family.
  • Sarfaraz Khan, Rishabh Pant, and Shubman Gill had fun on a yacht in Sydney.
  • KL Rahul and Athiya Shetty celebrated from their hotel room, eagerly awaiting their first child.
"New Year's Eve is a time for celebration with loved ones, and our cricketers certainly did not miss the chance to enjoy!"

The New Year celebrations among these cricketers reflect a blend of personal and public lives, showcasing their joy as they welcomed 2025.

item.title: 'I don’t miss international cricket': MS Dhoni opens up on Team India retirement - The Times of India
item.description:
MS Dhoni Reflects on His Retirement from International Cricket

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Former Indian cricket team captain MS Dhoni shares his thoughts on his decision to retire from international cricket, expressing that he does not miss playing on the world stage.

  • Dhoni emphasized the joy he found in cricket during his playing days.
  • He stated that his focus is now on family and personal projects.
  • The retired captain noted the changing dynamics of cricket and younger players rising to prominence.
"I don’t miss international cricket; I’ve moved on to a different phase of my life."

Dhoni's reflections highlight a transition from competitive sports to personal enjoyment, marking a significant moment in his post-retirement journey.

item.title: India ace goes past Ashwin’s all-time record in Test rankings - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Zimbabwe's Williams and Ervine Shine in Test Rankings; Nissanka and Santner Move Up in T20Is

Published on: [Date] - Source: ICC Cricket

Sean Williams and Craig Ervine have made significant gains in the latest MRF Tyres ICC Men's Test Player Rankings, with Williams breaking into the top 20 for the first time in his career. Meanwhile, T20I series between New Zealand and Sri Lanka saw Pathum Nissanka and Mitchell Santner making strides in the ICC Men's T20I Player Rankings.

  1. Sean Williams jumps 10 places to 19th in Test rankings with 653 rating points, his best since Brendan Taylor in 2014.
  2. Craig Ervine moves up five places to equal 47th position in Test rankings.
  3. Brian Bennett enters the top 100 Test bowlers after his maiden five-wicket haul.
  4. Pathum Nissanka gains three places to close in on the top five batters in T20I rankings.
  5. Mitchell Santner jumps into the top 10 of the T20I bowling rankings.

These moves reflect the growing competitiveness and depth of Zimbabwe's Test side and the exciting performances in the ongoing T20I series.

item.title: ‘India may have lost grip on Border Gavaskar Trophy’: Ravi Shastri, adds ‘two seniors and a youngster’ under scrutiny - The Indian Express
item.description:
India may have lost grip on Border Gavaskar Trophy: Ravi Shastri

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: The Indian Express

Former India coach Ravi Shastri expressed concerns over India's performance in the recent Boxing Day Test, suggesting that poor shot selection led to losing the Border Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Shastri highlights poor performances from key players, including the captain.
  • Australia leads the series 2-1 heading into the final Test.
  • He mentions specific criticisms towards Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Rishabh Pant.
“Some poor shot selection on either side of the middle session on the final day cost India the game.” - Ravi Shastri

This unfavorable performance raises questions about the team's future and strategy as they prepare for the last Test match.

item.title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Rain, turning pitch and Shubman Gill’s return dominate talks ahead of New Year’s Test in Sydney - The Indian Express
item.description:
Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Rain, turning pitch and Shubman Gill’s return dominate talks ahead of New Year’s Test in Sydney

Publication Date: January 1, 2023
Source: The Indian Express

As India prepares for the final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Sydney, discussions pivot around the impact of rain and the potential return of Shubman Gill to the playing eleven. India needs a win to clinch the trophy, while Australia leads the series 2-1.

  • Rain is forecasted for Day 4 and Day 5, which may affect the outcome of the match.
  • India aims to retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy; a draw would suffice if they finish the series 2-2.
  • Former cricketer Glenn McGrath emphasizes on Jasprit Bumrah's evolution as a bowler.
  • Shubman Gill's place in the playing eleven remains uncertain, causing strategic discussions among the team management.
“He had good pace, but his action was completely different... I suggested it would be better if he went straight through the crease.” - Glenn McGrath on Jasprit Bumrah

The upcoming Test at SCG promises to be pivotal as India seeks to redeem itself in what has been a chaotic series. All eyes will be on how the team adapts amidst weather concerns and lineup decisions.

item.title: Ban on F1 teams finally lifted ahead of major rules reset - Racingnews365.com
item.description:
Ban on F1 teams finally lifted ahead of major rules reset

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Formula 1 News

The 10 F1 teams are now allowed to begin designing their cars for the 2026 season following the lifting of a ban on aerodynamic testing. This change is part of a significant overhaul of technical regulations aimed at making cars smaller and incorporating active aerodynamics.

  • The ban previously restricted teams from wind-tunnel and aerodynamic testing until January 1, 2025.
  • Teams now face challenges in balancing development for both the 2025 and 2026 seasons.
  • The limited number of wind-tunnel runs poses a dilemma for teams in tight championship battles.
  • Historical context shows previous regulations changes can upend team performance rankings.

“If two teams are locked into a close championship battle for the 2025 crowns...they must tread the fine-line of trying to win that championship as opposed to completely neglecting 2026.”

This lifting of the ban sets the stage for extensive development in preparation for the upcoming changes, which will not only affect the design of the cars but also how teams strategize their approach to the 2025 season.

item.title: Senior Indian Player Wants To Be Interim Test Captain, Claims To Be Mr Fix-It: Report - Times Now
item.description:
Senior Indian Player Wants Interim Test Captaincy Amid Team Struggles

Publication Date: January 2023 | Source: Times Now

Amidst India's disappointing performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, speculation surrounds the leadership condition of the team, particularly regarding Rohit Sharma's captaincy.

  • The selectors may reconsider Rohit Sharma's captaincy if India fails to reach the World Test Championship final.
  • A senior player is positioning himself as 'Mr. Fix-It' for an interim captaincy role.
  • Rohit Sharma has struggled as captain, scoring only 31 runs in the current series.
  • India's Test performance has declined under Rohit's captaincy, notably losing all three home Tests against New Zealand.
  • The upcoming fifth Test from January 3 to 7 is crucial for India to retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
“Rohit may take a call about his career after the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.”

The future of India's Test leadership is uncertain as the team grapples with significant challenges on the field.

item.title: "What Happens In Dressing Room...": Irfan Pathan Fumes At Gautam Gambhir's Team India Leaks - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Irfan Pathan Expresses Outrage Over Team India Dressing Room Leaks

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: NDTV

The atmosphere within the Indian cricket team dressing room has come under scrutiny, following comments from head coach Gautam Gambhir and former cricketer Irfan Pathan. Pathan emphasized that internal matters should remain private.

  • Disagreements reported between Gautam Gambhir, BCCI selectors, and captain Rohit Sharma.
  • Irfan Pathan tweeted about the importance of keeping dressing room matters confidential.
  • Gambhir expressed frustration after a loss to Australia, wanting to assert control over team strategy.
  • Conflict over team selections, notably involving players Harshit Rana and Washington Sundar.
  • Gambhir’s request for Cheteshwar Pujara's inclusion was denied by the selection committee.
“What happens in the dressing room, should stay in the dressing room!” — Irfan Pathan (@IrfanPathan)

In conclusion, the public revelations regarding team disagreements raise questions about the internal dynamics of the Indian cricket team, highlighting the need for discretion in handling sensitive matters.
